channel.title: SPARKS on RD's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in SPARKS on RD's Blog

item.title: FIRST OF first
item.description: before you start the journey here…

item.title: Systems We Build, Systems We Are
What Would a Biological Protocol Look Like?
Life Runs on Protocols
item.description: Like us, life negotiates. Systems within systems.

item.title: Protocol Layers in Biology — From Molecules to Systems
item.description: Life is not chaos — it runs on layered, negotiated protocols, from molecules to whole organisms.

item.title: Molecular Layer — How Proteins Negotiate
item.description: Protein interactions aren’t random — they follow strict molecular protocols.

item.title: Cellular Layer — How Cells Negotiate and Confirm Signals
item.description: Cells don’t just listen — they negotiate, confirm, and regulate communication.

item.title: Network Layer — How Cells Resolve Conflicting Signals
item.description: Cells handle conflicting orders through internal negotiation — a network protocol at work.

item.title: System Layer — Protocols for Organism-Wide Coordination
item.description: Organisms coordinate as a whole — through long-distance protocols that manage survival.

item.title: Network Protocols vs. Biological Protocols — Advanced Parallels
item.description: From TCP handshakes to receptor-ligand negotiations, life runs on protocols — structured, layered, and architectural.

item.title: Data Structures and Biological Architecture
item.description: How data structures shape biological behavior — from protein complexes to signaling networks.

item.title: Algorithms and Biological Behavior
item.description: Biology as computation — signaling cascades as algorithms, evolution as optimization.

item.title: Rethinking Life as Protocol — A Philosophical Exploration
item.description: What if life itself is nothing but a system of protocols? From molecules to consciousness, from birth to death — to exist is to negotiate.
